title: Which sword has the most badass hilt? - Quora

response.answer_text: I honestly don't think Kampilans are that amazing. I’m Filipino American and have done Arnis since I was five. I've also gotten to see swords from damn near every culture that makes them.  Here’s the two I have. The top one dates back to around pre-WW2. The bottom one we’ve had museums in the Philippines ask for. Needless to say, they're pretty old. So is the giant kris blade underneath it which is probably older than 100. Here's two of my favorites:  This is the state sword of Hawaii. It's a gold handle with carvings and has a I believe a ruby unlaced at the pommel. its really a beautiful sword to see.  This sword is for all of us who don't have a kings budget. This is the Cold Steel Horseman’s basket hilt broadsword. While I have their normal basket hilt, this one really was nice. It’s a simple design sure, but it has nice refined lines in the handle. It’s a sword not a fashion statement, it does its job while looking good. It's the quiet badass that doesn't say much leading up to a fight but when it happens, it takes care of business. There’s my picks for which swords look badass. If you want something that calls for attention, it's hard to go wrong with a sword fit for a king. If you want a sword for the everyday man that still looks good there's another choice.

For me it is the Shiavona, the Swiss Saber, the Katzbalger, and The Doge from Albion. The Shiavona has several forms, this is one, a Venetian schiavona, type 2a, of the late 17th century (from Wikipedia).  And this is a Swiss Saber made by Arms & Armor.  Arms & Armor Katzbalger  The Doge Venetian Medieval Sword
